meanings.definition: The act of reversing or canceling something that has been done.
meanings.sent1: Her quick decision to apologize was the undoing of the argument.
meanings.sent2: Pressing the 'undo' button on the computer reverses the last action.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the clock ended up being the undoing of its functionality.
meanings.sent4: The undoing of the spell caused chaos in the magical world.
meanings.sent5: The magician's undoing of the trick revealed his secrets.

meanings.sent1: The villain's undoing was his own arrogance.
meanings.sent2: The hero's undoing came when he underestimated the enemy.
meanings.sent3: His undoing in the game was due to his lack of strategy.
meanings.sent4: The undoing of the empire was foretold by the ancient prophecy.
meanings.sent5: The undoing of the evil queen was celebrated by the kingdom.

meanings.definition: The cause of someone's failure or downfall.
meanings.sent1: His laziness proved to be his undoing in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal of his closest friend was his undoing in the political arena.
meanings.sent3: Her undoing in the exam was her lack of preparation.
meanings.sent4: The undoing of the company was attributed to poor management.
meanings.sent5: The undoing of the plan was the unexpected storm.
